items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight and into Friday morning.

Further heavy showers are forecasted overnight.  We expect river levels to remain high overnight and start to fall during Friday morning.  Flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river is possible, although no flooding to properties is forecast.

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Friday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim
Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River, Hawkcombe Stream, Monksilver Stream, Doniford Stream

items.message: River levels in the West Somerset area are continuing to rise as a result of heavy, persistent rainfall this morning, 13/05/21. Further rainfall is forecast for this afternoon and so the flood alert remains in force.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today. Areas most at risk are the Horner Water, Rivers Aller and Washford, and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Visit the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated on Friday 14/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.message:

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Friday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

River levels are rising at the Chiselborough, Donyatt and Ashford Mill river gauges as a result of heavy rainfall this morning, 13/05/21. The flood alert threshold has now been met. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible. Areas most at risk are roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur. Further rainfall is forecast this afternoon, 13/05/21. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  This message will be updated tomorrow, 14/05/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Hillfarrance Brook, Halsewater Stream, River Tone

items.message: River levels remain high at the Bishops Hull river gauge in response to the heavy rainfall throughout today.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible.  There is a risk of flooding to low lying land and roads near Hillfarrance, Bradford on Tone, Lane End Road at Ham and the Creech St Michael to Henlade road. Bradford on Tone ringbanks will be bankfull.   We are closely monitoring the situation. Further showery rainfall is forecast overnight.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated tomorrow, 14/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers in the Forest of Dean
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Parkend river gauge as a result of localised heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible overnight tonight. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Gloucester to Chepstow. Other locations that may be affected include Westbury and Lydney.   
We expect river levels to remain high until Friday, 14/05/2021.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.
This message will be updated by 10:00 on 14/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Doniford Stream in the Sampford Mill Farm area
items.message: River levels are rising rapidly as a result of persistent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of property is possible today, 13/05/21.  Areas most at risk are the Sampford Mill Farm area.   Further persistent rainfall is forecast until later this afternoon, 13/05/21.  We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are checking and clearing weed screens, bridges and culverts.  Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Please stay aware in case further warnings are issued. This message will be updated this afternoon 13/05/21, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Little Alne river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of property roads and farmland is possible tonight Thursday 13 May 2021. Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Arrow between Studley and Salford Priors and the River Alne between Bird in Hand and Alcester on the River Alne including farmland and caravan parks.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, Friday 14 May 2021, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Shipston river gauge as a result of prolonged heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible tomorrow morning, Friday 14 May 2021.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to https://direct.fws.environment-agency.gov.uk/app/messageSetSelected?method=messageSetSelected#avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, Friday 14 May 2021, or as the situation changes.
